name: Tarragon and Lemon Lobster Scampi
author: Reynolds Kitchens(R)
summary: Be fancy without the fuss with this delightful shellfish dish from Teri Lyn Fisher and Jenny Park of Spoon Fork Bacon.
ingredients: 4 (8 ounce) lobster tails, split in half lengthwise
2 ears corn on the cob, cut into 4 or 5 pieces
directions: Place 2 large sheets of Reynolds Wrap® Aluminum Foil onto a clean surface
In the center of each piece of foil, place an even, single layer of onion and lemon slices
Top the onion and lemon with lobster tails, cut-side up (2 per foil sheet), and corn
In a small mixing bowl, whisk together butter, wine, garlic and tarragon
Gently fold up the edges of the foil around the food to create a shallow bowl
Pour butter mixture over the tails and corn and top with thyme sprigs
Double fold top and ends to seal packet, leaving room for heat circulation inside
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until tails just cook through
Open packets carefully by cutting along top fold with a sharp knife, allowing steam to escape; then open top of foil packet
Serve with drawn butter and lemon wedges
